availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moreau B. Pulliam (Mercer Co, Harrodsburg, Ky, carpenter & lieut, sgt, maj, commissary 11th Ky Cav USA)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Ann Wood Pulliam on March 17, 1836. Married to Louisa M. Alexander Pulliam on September 3, 1853. Father of Judson Pulliam, Robert Pulliam, John Pulliam, and Davis Pulliam. Carpenter in Mercer County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1850. Employed John Ruse, Charles Bradshaw, Benjamin Minter, Walker Pulliam, Coleman Vanduer, and John Boise as carpenters in Mercer County in 1850. Boss carpenter in Harrodsburg in 1860. Employed John Pierce, C Hendricks, Samuel Bailey, and Charles Vanarsdale as carpenters, and Alexander Green as a saddler, in Harrodsburg in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Harrodsburg in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant, sergeant, major, and commissary from 1862 to 1865.
